sourcesContent:
export const placeInfo = [
  {
    id: 1,
    headerTitle: 'Medusa (1597)',
    headerSubTitle: 'Fine Arts',
    headerText:
      "One of Caravaggio's best known works, one of the most outstanding Italian painters of all time. This work depicts the...",
    title: 'Medusa (1597)',
    description:
      "One of Caravaggio's best known works, one of the most outstanding Italian painters of all time. This work depicts the mythological figure of the jellyfish, a creature that has snakes in place of hair and with the power to turn people into stone whenever they look straight into their eyes. Caravaggio's Medusa is currently located at the Uffizi Gallery in Florence, Italy.",
    img: '.././images/medusa.jpg',
    maps:
      'https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m14!1m8!1m3!1d11524.977544425776!2d11.2553108!3d43.7677856!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x0%3A0xcddeb7c89bf0c4cd!2sUffizi%20Gallery!5e0!3m2!1sen!2sbr!4v1576120880058!5m2!1sen!2sbr'
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    headerTitle: 'Abaporu (1928)',
    headerSubTitle: 'Fine Arts',
    headerText:
      'This is the most iconic work by Tarsília do Amaral, a Brazilian artist known as one of the main precursors of Brazilian...',
    title: 'Abaporu (1928)',
    description:
      'This is the most iconic work by Tarsília do Amaral, a Brazilian artist known as one of the main precursors of Brazilian Modernism. Abaporu, Tupi-Guarani name of origin and meaning "man who eats people", was the initial milestone of the Anthropophagic Movement, which consisted in the swallowing of foreign culture that came to Brazil, adapting it to the reality of the country. Tarsilia painted Abaporu as a birthday present for her husband at the time, writer Oswald de Andrade. Currently, this painting is the most valued Brazilian canvas in the world art market. Abaporu is exhibited at the Museum of Latin American Art of Buenos Aires (MALBA) in the Argentine capital.',
    img: '.././images/abaporu.jpg',
    maps:
      'https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m14!1m8!1m3!1d13140.269313958117!2d-58.4035371!3d-34.5771629!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x0%3A0xeea87be2795e86d2!2sMALBA!5e0!3m2!1sen!2sbr!4v1576163069343!5m2!1sen!2sbr'
  },
  {
    id: 3,
    headerTitle: 'The Girls (1656)',
    headerSubTitle: 'Fine Arts',
    headerText:
      "One of Diego Velázquez's most popular works, regarded as one of the leading artists of the Spanish Golden Century, The Girls is part...",
    title: 'The Girls (1656)',
    description:
      "One of Diego Velázquez's most popular works, regarded as one of the leading artists of the Spanish Golden Century, The Girls is part of a phase that the artist termed as La Familia. During this period, Velázquez represented scenes from everyday life. In the case of this work, we see the young infanta Margarida Teresa of Habsburg surrounded by her small court of ladies and servants. This famous painting is considered one of the most analyzed in the world, mainly because of its complexity and enigmatic composition. The Girls is currently on display at the Prado Museum in Madrid.",
    img: '.././images/thegirls.jpg',
    maps:
      'https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m14!1m8!1m3!1d12151.109604603413!2d-3.6921271!3d40.4137818!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x0%3A0x1094f07d93ad885a!2sMuseo%20Nacional%20del%20Prado!5e0!3m2!1sen!2sbr!4v1576163257369!5m2!1sen!2sbr'
  },
  {
    id: 4,
    headerTitle: 'The Night Watch (1639 - 1642)',
    headerSubTitle: 'Fine Arts',
    headerText:
      "This is one of the best known works of Rembrandt, a Dutch artist who stood out for his baroque paintings...",
    title:
      'The Night Watch (1639 - 1642)',
    description:
      "This is one of the best known works of Rembrandt, a Dutch artist who stood out for his baroque paintings. Rembrandt designed this work to order from the Amsterdam Arcabuziers Corporation, which wished to decorate the hall of the company's headquarters. So the artist created The Night Watch, which was originally to be called The Company of Captain Frans Banning Cocq and Lieutenant Willem van Ruytenburch Preparing to Move Forward which has a huge size: 5 meters long and almost 4 meters high. The Night Watch, considered Rembrandt's magnum opus, is currently on display at the Rijksmuseum, the national museum of the Netherlands, located in Amsterdam.",
    img: '.././images/thelastnight.jpg',
    maps:
      'https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m14!1m8!1m3!1d9746.29900108388!2d4.8852188!3d52.3599976!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x0%3A0xd54373ae6a408585!2sRijksmuseum!5e0!3m2!1sen!2sbr!4v1576163404217!5m2!1sen!2sbr'
  },
  {
    id: 5,
    headerTitle: 'The Last Judgment (1535 - 1541)',
    headerSubTitle: 'Fine Arts',
    headerText: 'One of the works that helped immortalize Michelangelo as one of the most important artists of all time! The Last Judgment...',
    title: 'The Last Judgment (1535 - 1541)',
    description:
      'One of the works that helped immortalize Michelangelo as one of the most important artists of all time! The Last Judgment is a huge fresco that occupies the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel in the Vatican. Inspired by the biblical narration, the artist reproduces images that represent the moment of the resurrection of the dead and Divine Justice. This fresco was made after the extensive set of paintings Michelangelo had already made on the ceiling of the Chapel (1508 - 1512), representing nine scenes from Genesis (creation of the world). The Creation of Adam, however, is considered one of the most famous. Both works of the Italian painter are considered landmarks of Renaissance painting and one of the most iconic in the history of art.',
    img: '.././images/thelastjudgement.jpg',
    maps:
      'https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m14!1m8!1m3!1d11878.123195325199!2d12.4544835!3d41.9029468!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x0%3A0xab16c8877fb53e22!2sSistine%20Chapel!5e0!3m2!1sen!2sbr!4v1576163535971!5m2!1sen!2sbr'
  },
  {
    id: 6,
    headerTitle: 'The Persistence of Memory (1931)',
    headerSubTitle: 'Fine Arts',
    headerText: "This is another outstanding work and constantly referenced as one of the most impactful paintings in popular culture. Authored by...",
    title: 'The Persistence of Memory (1931)',
    description:
      "This is another outstanding work and constantly referenced as one of the most impactful paintings in popular culture. Authored by Catalan painter Salvador Dalí, The Persistence of Memory is one of the main symbols of Surrealism, an artistic style that characterized most of the works of the According to Dalí, this painting was almost entirely made in just two hours, and the painter took only five hours to fully complete this magnificent work. Currently, the work is on display at the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), in New York, in the United States.",
    img: '.././images/thepersistence.jpg',
    maps:
      'https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m14!1m8!1m3!1d12088.107669490293!2d-73.9776216!3d40.761432699999986!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x0%3A0xea9f8fc0b3ffff55!2sThe%20Museum%20of%20Modern%20Art!5e0!3m2!1sen!2sbr!4v1576163978003!5m2!1sen!2sbr'
  }
];

export const reviews = [
  {
    id: 1,
    name: 'John',
    avatar: '.././avatars/avatar-1.png',
    comment:
      'Although so old, I am happy to see this work of art. Magnificent and imposing as any painting to be.'
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    name: 'Mike',
    avatar: '.././avatars/avatar-2.png',
    comment:
      "Guys, I'm in love with this painting. I can spend hours looking and admiring this wonder. I would like to have known the author this work of art."
  },
  {
    id: 3,
    name: 'Sofia',
    avatar: '.././avatars/avatar-3.png',
    comment:
      'How not to be enchanted with such beauty! This shows that we are all able to improve the world, just want to.'
  },
  {
    id: 4,
    name: 'Joseph',
    avatar: '.././avatars/avatar-4.png',
    comment:
      'Nothing more comforting than admiring the beauties of the world in a pleasant environment. Congratulations to the artist! He was very inspired.'
  },
  {
    id: 5,
    name: 'Natasha',
    avatar: '.././avatars/avatar-5.png',
    comment:
      'No words to describe how I felt when I saw this screen. It touched me deeply.'
  }
];

export const detailInfo = {
  id: 1,
    headerTitle: 'The Persistence of Memory (1931)',
    headerSubTitle: 'Fine Arts',
    headerText: "This is another outstanding work and constantly referenced as one of the most impactful paintings in popular culture. Authored by...",
    title: 'The Persistence of Memory (1931)',
    description:
      "This is another outstanding work and constantly referenced as one of the most impactful paintings in popular culture. Authored by Catalan painter Salvador Dalí, The Persistence of Memory is one of the main symbols of Surrealism, an artistic style that characterized most of the works of the According to Dalí, this painting was almost entirely made in just two hours, and the painter took only five hours to fully complete this magnificent work. Currently, the work is on display at the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), in New York, in the United States.",
    img: '.././images/thepersistence.jpg',
    maps:
      'https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m14!1m8!1m3!1d12088.107669490293!2d-73.9776216!3d40.761432699999986!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x0%3A0xea9f8fc0b3ffff55!2sThe%20Museum%20of%20Modern%20Art!5e0!3m2!1sen!2sbr!4v1576163978003!5m2!1sen!2sbr'
  };

export const news = [
  {
    id: 1,
    newsTitle: 'To interact, feel and think',
    newsText:
      'The course of the Main Exhibition symbolizes this invitation. On the second floor of the Museum, the audience walks through a multimedia narrative structured in five great moments - Cosmos, Earth, Anthropocene, Tomorrow and Us - each embodying great questions that humanity has always asked itself - Where did we come from? Who we are? Where are we? Where are we going? How do we want to go?'
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    newsTitle: 'A question path',
    newsText:
      'Cosmos addresses the view that we are made of the same matter as the stars, we connect with the universe and our origins. Here the visitor is already beginning to deal with the questions that will guide his journey: what are the dimensions of our existence? How did we get here? What future do we want?'
  },
  {
    id: 3,
    newsTitle: 'Rethink the future. What will it be like?',
    newsText:
      "In the spaces reserved for temporary exhibitions, the Museum of Tomorrow presented, at its inauguration, two:“ Perimetral ”- a video installation about the implosion of the high that has marked the urban landscape of the Port Region for decades - and“ It is Allowed to Allow ”, that brought together three projects from the Superflex, a collective of Danish artists."
  },
  {
    id: 4,
    newsTitle: 'Tomorrows',
    newsText:
      "Can a museum hold tomorrow's possibilities? At the Museum of Tomorrow, this question is diluted by its exhibitions. In both the main and temporary exhibitions there are experiences for the audience to see, feel, interact with, enjoy. The ultimate goal, however, is to provoke - to ask questions rather than answer them. And, going through all this dialogue, is an essential invitation of the Museum to its visitors: together we will build the Tomorrow we want."
  },
  {
    id: 5,
    newsTitle: 'Temporary Exhibition: For Everyone',
    newsText:
      'On the bright side, many promising initiatives are underway, alternatives focusing on reducing inequalities with more positive results for the preservation of our biodiversity. Schedule yourself! The opening of the exhibition takes place on December 12, within the visiting hours of the Museum.'
  },
  {
    id: 6,
    newsTitle: 'Trip: A Returnless Trip',
    newsText:
      'The new experience called IRIS + is also triggered by this card (from IRIS). But the difference is that at the end of the route, next to the US area, IRIS gets its voice - the hearing impaired, or whoever they prefer, can chat via chat - and talk directly with the visitor. There are six self-service totems, two for the priority use of wheelchair users and children. The dialogue begins with the indication of the visitor about his main concern from what he has just experienced.'
  }
];
